newsitem.title: USA: NY precious metals end sharply up on shortcovering.
newsitem.headline: NY precious metals end sharply up on shortcovering.

text.p: News that gold reserves at the Bre-X Busang project in Indonesia may be less than originally thought gave dealers a ready excuse to cover their short positions ahead of first delivery notice next week, dealers and analysts said.

"This market was looking for an excuse to rally and the Bre-X news simply sent people scrambling," Dinsa Mehta of Chase Manhattan said. "This was a plank to stage a shortcovering rally and also an indicator that it's a dangerous thing to be on the short side in the $340s in gold."
COMEX June gold ended $3.00 firmer at $353.50 an ounce.
